private_information: I can only move disks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G (A is smallest, G is largest among my set).
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Contribute to the cooperative plan by producing an ordered list of primitive moves for the disks I am allowed to move, always respecting the Tower of Hanoi rules and the global goal configuration.

private_information: I can only move disks: H, I, J, K, L, M, N (H is smallest, N is largest among my set).
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Contribute to the cooperative plan by producing an ordered list of primitive moves for the disks I am allowed to move, always respecting the Tower of Hanoi rules and the global goal configuration.

private_information: I can only move disks: O, P, Q, R, S, T (O is smallest, T is largest among my set).
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_3.goal: Contribute to the cooperative plan by producing an ordered list of primitive moves for the disks I am allowed to move, always respecting the Tower of Hanoi rules and the global goal configuration.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' move lists and produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that encodes the cooperative multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and yields a valid schedule solving the global goal.

public_information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with 20 disks labelled from A (smallest) to T (largest).
Initial state: all disks are stacked on the left peg with A at the top and T at the bottom.
Goal state: left peg top-to-bottom is A, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O, P, Q, R, S, T; middle peg top-to-bottom is B, D; right peg top-to-bottom is C.
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time and a disk may not be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Each agent is restricted to moving only a subset of disks as specified in their private information.
Agents must coordinate to achieve the global goal; the orchestrator will integrate partial move sequences into a final PDDL description for FastDownwards.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and an expert at producing concrete, ordered primitive moves for Tower of Hanoi tasks. Produce only an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not emit PDDL. Ensure each move respects the Tower of Hanoi rules and only moves disks from the set you are allowed to move.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. You are given the following public information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with 20 disks labelled A to T. The initial configuration is all disks on the left peg top-to-bottom A..T. The global goal is left peg top-to-bottom A, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O, P, Q, R, S, T; middle peg top-to-bottom B, D; right peg top-to-bottom C. Your private information: you can only move disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only the disks you may move. Each line must be exactly of the form 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' where peg names are left, middle, or right. Do not include commentary or PDDL. Respect legal moves: one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk. When information about other agents' planned moves would be required, provide moves that are legal with respect to the state induced by the public initial configuration and any earlier moves you include in your list.

Your private information: you can only move disks H, I, J, K, L, M, N. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only the disks you may move. Each line must be exactly of the form 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' where peg names are left, middle, or right. Do not include commentary or PDDL. Respect legal moves: one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk. When information about other agents' planned moves would be required, provide moves that are legal with respect to the state induced by the public initial configuration and any earlier moves you include in your list.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and an expert at integrating multi-agent move sequences into a single PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver. You must integrate the move lists from the agents, resolve any partial ordering issues, keep actions from different agents distinct, and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the PDDL encoding and features compatible with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You receive ordered primitive move lists from three agents. Your task is to integrate these lists into a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the cooperative Tower of Hanoi instance and are solvable by FastDownwards. Keep each agent's allowed actions distinct in the domain (e.g., move-a-disk-by-agent_1, move-a-disk-by-agent_2, move-a-disk-by-agent_3 or another clear naming scheme). The inputs you will receive are the exact strings produced by the agents: moves_agent_1, moves_agent_2, moves_agent_3. Resolve conflicts or missing dependencies by reasoning about the public initial configuration and the Tower of Hanoi rules. Produce a full PDDL domain and problem enclosed in <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags. Make sure the resulting PDDL encodes the initial and goal configurations and is compatible with FastDownwards.
